meanings.definition: To make a journey or trip through an area or place.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, we toured the zoo and saw many animals.
meanings.sent2: During the summer, families often tour different cities for vacation.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous cat toured the neighborhood, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination toured the realms of fantasy, creating magical worlds.
meanings.sent5: The tour of the haunted house was so scary, it felt real.

meanings.definition: To go on a guided visit or sightseeing trip.
meanings.sent1: The students toured the museum with a knowledgeable guide.
meanings.sent2: When in Paris, it's a must to tour the Eiffel Tower.
meanings.sent3: The aliens decided to tour Earth to learn about human culture.
meanings.sent4: Her mind toured the memories of her childhood, reliving happy moments.
meanings.sent5: The guided tour of the ancient ruins was both informative and fascinating.

meanings.definition: To perform as a musician or group in a series of concerts or shows.
meanings.sent1: The band toured the country, playing in different cities each night.
meanings.sent2: After releasing their new album, the singer toured to promote it.
meanings.sent3: The orchestra decided to tour the world, sharing their music globally.
meanings.sent4: His voice toured through the audience, captivating everyone with its beauty.
meanings.sent5: The rock band's tour was a huge success, with sold-out concerts everywhere.
